localised_text.last_approved_text: Corruption affects [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:public_order}}. Should corruption become too high, then the forces of either [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos or [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]Vampire Counts will emerge in the province. A high level of corruption can cause armies to suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition.

localised_text.last_approved_text: [[sl:battle_battle_game]]Battles[[/sl]] are contested by armies, each of which is made up of many troop [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]]. The player commands an army when taking part in a battle.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Artillery [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]], such as cannons and catapults, can fire projectiles at the enemy over long distances. They are most useful against bunched [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]] formations, [[sl:battle_monsters]]monsters[[/sl]], and enemy [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortifications[[/sl]].

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Artillery [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]], such as cannons and catapults, can fire projectiles at the enemy over long distances. They are most useful against bunched [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]] formations, [[sl:battle_monsters]]monsters[[/sl]], and enemy [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortifications[[/sl]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: Battles are fought between [[sl:battle_armies]]armies[[/sl]] to conquer or defend territory. Battles are won by killing or routing all enemy [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]], or by capturing the enemy settlement during a [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battle[[/sl]].

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Battles are fought between [[sl:battle_armies]]armies[[/sl]] to conquer or defend territory. Battles are won by killing or routing all enemy [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]], or by capturing the enemy settlement during a [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battle[[/sl]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: The battle interface is made up of many separate elements such as the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]] and its [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit cards[[/sl]], the [[sl_tooltip:battle_radar_map]]radar map[[/sl_tooltip]], the [[sl:battle_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] panel and the [[sl_tooltip:battle_unit_portrait_panel]]Unit Portrait panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The battle interface is made up of many separate elements such as the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]] and its [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit cards[[/sl]], the [[sl_tooltip:battle_radar_map]]radar map[[/sl_tooltip]], the [[sl:battle_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] panel and the [[sl_tooltip:battle_unit_portrait_panel]]Unit Portrait panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: The battlefield is the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] on which the battle takes place. The edges of the battlefield are shown as white lines drawn on the battlefield when the [[sl:battle_camera_controls]]camera[[/sl]] is close.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The battlefield is the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] on which the battle takes place. The edges of the battlefield are shown as white lines drawn on the battlefield when the [[sl:battle_camera_controls]]camera[[/sl]] is close.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Move the camera in battle with the W, A, S and D keys. Orient the camera by holding the middle mouse button, and change the camera height with the scroll wheel.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Move the camera in battle with the W, A, S and D keys. Orient the camera by holding the middle mouse button, and change the camera height with the scroll wheel.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Towers, gates and other [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]] features may be captured by an attacker during a [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battle[[/sl]] if they take control of the nearby capture point.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Towers, gates and other [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]] features may be captured by an attacker during a [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battle[[/sl]] if they take control of the nearby capture point.

localised_text.last_approved_text: [[sl:battle_armies]]Army[[/sl]] commanders may arrange their [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] for the coming fight during the deployment phase of the battle. Once deployment is completed the battle begins.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: [[sl:battle_armies]]Army[[/sl]] commanders may arrange their [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] for the coming fight during the deployment phase of the battle. Once deployment is completed the battle begins.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Drop Siege Equipment button is shown at the bottom of the screen when a unit that is carrying siege equiment is selected.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Drop Siege Equipment button is shown at the bottom of the screen when a unit that is carrying siege equiment is selected.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Fire-at-will is a [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]unit ability[[/sl]] shared by all [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]]. When firing-at-will, [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] select their own targets to shoot at unless told otherwise.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Fire-at-will is a [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]unit ability[[/sl]] shared by all [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]]. When firing-at-will, [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] select their own targets to shoot at unless told otherwise.
{{tr:hp_battle_title_fire_at_will_link}}

localised_text.last_approved_text: [[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] fight most effectively against an enemy in front of them. A unit will take more casualties and its [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership level[[/sl]] will suffer when attacked in the flank or the rear.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: [[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] fight most effectively against an enemy in front of them. A unit will take more casualties and its [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership level[[/sl]] will suffer when attacked in the flank or the rear.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Some [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] fly high over the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]], either attacking at range or descending to engage the enemy in hand-to-hand fighting.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Some [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] fly high over the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]], either attacking at range or descending to engage the enemy in hand-to-hand fighting.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Multiple [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected units[[/sl]] may be assigned into a preset formation, in which they automatically take up positions in a specific arrangement.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Multiple [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected units[[/sl]] may be assigned into a preset formation, in which they automatically take up positions in a specific arrangement.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Formations button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when more than one unit is selected.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Formations button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when more than one unit is selected.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Large cities are fortified by walls, punctuated by towers and gates. The attacker must breach the fortifications during a [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battle[[/sl]] to take the city, while the defender can man the walls in an attempt to stop them.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Large cities are fortified by walls, punctuated by towers and gates. The attacker must breach the fortifications during a [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battle[[/sl]] to take the city, while the defender can man the walls in an attempt to stop them.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The game guide is a web resource that provides information about the game. It can be accessed at any time by pressing the F1 key.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The game guide is a web resource that provides information about the game. It can be accessed at any time by pressing the F1 key.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Group button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit is selected.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Group button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit is selected.

localised_text.last_approved_text: A selection of [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] may be grouped by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:battle_group_button]]Group button[[/sl_tooltip]] so that they may be easily re-selected in future. Grouped units are arranged together under a tab on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: A selection of [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] may be grouped by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:battle_group_button]]Group button[[/sl_tooltip]] so that they may be easily re-selected in future. localised_text.last_approved_text: The Guard button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit that can guard is selected.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Guard button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit that can guard is selected.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Infantry [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are dense formations of men armed with hand-to-hand weapons. Massed ranks of infantry are the mainstay of most [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] compositions.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Infantry [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are dense formations of men armed with hand-to-hand weapons. Massed ranks of infantry are the mainstay of most [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] compositions.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level of a [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] is a measure of its will to continue fighting. If a unit’s leadership level drops too low then the troops will rout from the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] and stop responding to orders.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level of a [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] is a measure of its will to continue fighting. If a unit’s leadership level drops too low then the troops will rout from the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] and stop responding to orders.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Melee Mode button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit that can toggle melee mode is selected.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The Melee Mode button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit that can toggle melee mode is selected.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Missile [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are best employed in battle to stand back from the action and fire, sling or hurl projectiles at the enemy.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Missile [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are best employed in battle to stand back from the action and fire, sling or hurl projectiles at the enemy.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Monsters and giants are huge, powerful creatures that inspire terror into their enemies. They are best used for scattering and disrupting formations of enemy [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]].

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Monsters and giants are huge, powerful creatures that inspire terror into their enemies. They are best used for scattering and disrupting formations of enemy [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: Mounted [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are able to move quickly across the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]], either in support of allied troops or to strike at the enemy where they are weakest.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Mounted [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are able to move quickly across the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]], either in support of allied troops or to strike at the enemy where they are weakest.

localised_text.last_approved_text: [[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] that are [[sl:battle_leadership]]routing[[/sl]] from the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] may rally and begin responding to orders again once they have retreated a safe distance from the enemy.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: [[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] that are [[sl:battle_leadership]]routing[[/sl]] from the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] may rally and begin responding to orders again once they have retreated a safe distance from the enemy.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Additional [[sl:battle_armies]]armies[[/sl]] drawn into a battle on the campaign map appear as reinforcements. Reinforcing armies appear at the edge of the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] during the fighting.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Additional [[sl:battle_armies]]armies[[/sl]] drawn into a battle on the campaign map appear as reinforcements. Reinforcing armies appear at the edge of the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] during the fighting.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Siege battles are fought over [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]] cities. The attacker must breach the defences and either capture the [[sl:battle_victory_points]]victory point[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_leadership]]rout[[/sl]] the defending [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] to gain control of the city.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Siege battles are fought over [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]] cities. The attacker must breach the defences and either capture the [[sl:battle_victory_points]]victory point[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_leadership]]rout[[/sl]] the defending [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] to gain control of the city.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Siege weapons are large, constructed weapons of war that are used to attack the [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortifications[[/sl]] during [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battles[[/sl]]. Rams are used to breach the city gates, and siege towers are used to get troops on top of the city walls.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Siege weapons are large, constructed weapons of war that are used to attack the [[sl:battle_fortifications]]fortifications[[/sl]] during [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battles[[/sl]]. {{tr:hp_battle_title_skirmishing_link}}

localised_text.last_approved_text: Some [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]] can skirmish, whereby they automatically retreat when the enemy get too close. The skirmish ability may be toggled on a selected [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] with the [[sl_tooltip:battle_skirmish_button]]Skirmish button[[/sl_tooltip]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: [[sl:battle_wizards]]Wizards[[/sl]] may cast powerful spells to turn the tide of battle. Available spells are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_winds_of_magic_panel]]Winds of Magic panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when a Wizard unit is selected.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: [[sl:battle_wizards]]Wizards[[/sl]] may cast powerful spells to turn the tide of battle. Available spells are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_winds_of_magic_panel]]Winds of Magic panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when a Wizard unit is selected.

localised_text.last_approved_text: The tactical map provides a birds-eye view of the entire [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] at once. Press the TAB key to toggle the tactical map on and off.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: The tactical map provides a birds-eye view of the entire [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] at once. Press the TAB key to toggle the tactical map on and off.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Terrain features on the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] can play a decisive role in any battle. Hills, mountains, forests and rivers can be used to [[sl:battle_visibility]]conceal troops[[/sl]] or funnel an enemy’s advance.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Each [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] is led by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord in battle, who leads and encourages the troops with many unique [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]abilities[[/sl]].

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Each [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] is led by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord in battle, who leads and encourages the troops with many unique [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]abilities[[/sl]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: Most [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] have abilities that modify the unit’s behaviour or improve it's capabilities for a short time. These can be activated or deactivated as the situation demands.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Each [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] in the player’s army is represented on the [[sl:battle_battle_interface]]battle interface[[/sl]] by a Unit card. These are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: The Unit Details panel shows detailed information about the selected [[sl:battle_units]]unit’s[[/sl]] fighting strength. It can be toggled on and off with the I key.

localised_text.last_approved_text: Right-click a position on the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] to order a selected [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] to walk there, or double-right-click to order it to run. localised_text.last_approved_text: A [[sl:battle_units]]unit’s[[/sl]] type broadly defines its capabilities, strengths and weaknesses. [[sl:battle_mounted_units]]Mounted units[[/sl]], for example, are generally swift but vulnerable against [[sl:battle_weapon_types]]spear weapons[[/sl]].

localised_text.last_approved_text: [[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] with closely aligned goals may choose to form an alliance through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]]. Allied factions commit at least to defending one another from foreign attack, and may optionally go to [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] together.

localised_text.last_approved_text: [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elves[[/sl]] earn [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber each time they capture an enemy [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]], or from every settlement held by an [[sl:campaign_alliances]]ally[[/sl]]. localised_text.last_approved_text: The world is embattled. But something has changed... A new champion of men has taken Sigmar’s throne. And so we stand at the verge of a new era, a chance for all to make their mark on these troubled lands. High King Thorgrim Grudgebearer has spent the last few centuries readying his kin, and now is the time to unleash the throngs!

localised_text.last_approved_text: The more armies you field, the harder it becomes to maintain them all. As supply lines become more complex, gold and supplies will ‘go missing’ - your officials having little idea where they may have gone...

localised_text.last_approved_text: Athel Loren gives its energy to the Asrai as they grow. The stronger they become, the more power they draw from the forests. For every army you field, the more expensive it becomes to maintain them; drawing strength from Athel Loren comes with a price.

ui_text_replacements.localised_text: Athel Loren gives its energy to the Asrai as they grow. The stronger they become, the more power they draw from the forests. For every army you field, the more expensive it becomes to maintain them; drawing strength from Athel Loren comes with a price.

localised_text.last_approved_text: As your realm grows, you will require the aid of other Lords whose loyalty may be tied more strongly to their Clans, or who may have ancient debts of blood and gold to pay. In either case, they will serve those interests before allegiance to the High King – although they would never admit to such a thing!

In either case, they will serve those interests before allegiance to the High King – although they would never admit to such a thing!

If the Winds of Dhar are shared between powerful Vampires and Necromancers, however, Dark Magic becomes more difficult to accumulate - their Undead legions requiring more energy to remain bound.
